name: Fuga da Alcatraz
description:
Fuga Da Alcatraz is a Desktop Vr Experience inspired by the real escape accomplished by Frank Morris in 1962.

In this experience you will become Morris, and by following the hints given by Geremia (your little helper), and by carefully listening to what the NPCs say, you will be able to escape from the prison. The main challenge will be finding the right objects, add them to the inventory and finally use them to escape. 

The whole Alcatraz environment has been modelled and texturised from scratch. 

CONTROLS

  • WASD + mouse: to move into the environment 
  • E: to interact with objects (e.g. adding items to inventory or open doors)
  • Space bar: resume game after the dialogue boxes appear/jump
  • I: open/close inventory
  • C: stop digging
  • esc: return to main menu

LANGUAGE: Italian. 

ADDITIONAL INFO

This application was created for the Virtual Reality Course at Politecnico di Torino, by four Cinema and Media Engineering Students (at their Master's degree): Andrea De Luca, Arianna Ferraris, Federica Cuomo and Gaia Lecis. This was our first experience in creating a Desktop VR application.
